intro: Gymnogynum domingense, commonly known as the Dominican morning glory, is a climbing vine native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. Its flowers are typically pollinated by insects, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Gymnogynum domingense is often found in moist, shaded areas in tropical and subtropical regions.
